property.name: Subtitle
property.value: You Have Been Chosen

property.name: Text
property.value: Each asset you control with health gets +1 heath. Each asset you control with sanity gets +1 sanity. ι When the game begins, if The Star XVII is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Relic. Occult. Blessed.

property.name: Text
property.value: Limit 1 per deck. ι When you play a copy of Soothing Melody: Either change each "2" on it to "3", or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced – After Hallowed Mirror enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Soothing Melody. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: The Journey is Complete

property.name: Text
property.value: θ If you have 8 or more cards in your hand, exhaust The World XXI: Draw 1 card. ι When the game begins, if The World XXI is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Tome. Occult.

property.name: Text
property.value: Limit 1 per deck. ι When you play a copy of Blood-Rite: Either change each "2" on it to "3", or shuffle it into your deck instead of discarding it. Forced After Occult Lexicon enters play: Search your bonded cards for 3 copies of Blood-Rite. Add 1 to your hand and shuffle the other 2 into your deck.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Charge Ever Onward

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When you would succeed at a skill test: You get +1 skill value for this test. You may discard Knight of Swords to get +3 instead. ι When the game begins, if Knight of Swords is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Limit 1 per investigator. θ Exhaust Well Connected: You get +1 skill value for this skill test for every 4 resources you have. θ Spend 2 resources: Ready Well Connected. (Limit once per round.)

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Your True Master Awaits

property.name: Text
property.value: You have 1 additional arcane slot. Your arcane slots can be used to hold cards that take up accessory slots, and vice versa. ι When the game begins, if The Hierophant V is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Ritual. Talent.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. You have 1 additional arcane slot, which can only be used to hold a Spell or Ritual asset. ι After you activate an η abilty on a Spell or Ritual asset, exhaust Sign Magick: Activate an [Aciton] ability on a different Spell or Ritual asset you control (without paying its η cost).

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Every Trial a Lesson

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When you draw a non-weakness encounter card, exhaust Nine of Rods: Cancel all of that card's effects and shuffle it into the encounter deck. Then, draw another card from the top of the encounter deck ι When the game begins, if Nine of Rods is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Fast. Play only during your turn. Until the end of your turn, set the base value of each of your skills to 5, or the base value of one of your skills to 7.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Unlimited Potential

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When you play a card, exhaust The Fool 0: Reduce that card's cost by 1. ι When the game begins, if The Fool 0 is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Item. Charm.

property.name: Text
property.value: You have 1 additional tarot slot. Each non-weakness Tarot asset in your hand or committed to a skill test gains ??. ι When the game begins, if Moon Pendant is in your opening hand: Put it into play.

property.name: Text
property.value: Permanent. Limit 1 per investigator. Before setting up each game, draw 3 random cards from the tarot deck and choose 1. Place the chosen card in front of you, in the upright position. Each other investigators ignores its effects. Shuffle the rest back into the tarot deck.

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Basic Weakness

property.name: Traits
property.value: Curse. Omen.

property.name: Text
property.value: Permanent. Before setting up each game, draw a random card from the tarot deck and place it in front of you, in the reverse position. Each other investigator ignores its effects.

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Your Shadow Hungers

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Basic Weakness

property.name: Traits
property.value: Omen. Tarot.

property.name: Text
property.value: You cannot play assets other than the Devil XV while it is in your hand. If The Devil XV is drawn in your opening hand during setup (before or after taking a mulligan), you cannot replace it. It must stay in your opening hand.

card.name: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

property.name: Text
property.value: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: — When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate shown here. Trapped Spirit –> Bloodthirsty Spirits Realm of Death –> Unstable Realm Inexorable Fate –> Unspeakable Fate Chilling Cold –> Chilling Mists (Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Disappearance at the Twilight Estate

property.name: Text
property.value: — Put the Spectral version of the Wine Celler (card #28) into play. _____ For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after its attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Witching Hour

property.name: Text
property.value: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: — When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Witching Hour shown here. City of Sins –> City of the Damned Ancient Evils –> Impending Evils Witchcraft –> Hexcraft Remove Arkham Woods (Quiet Glade) from the game. (Continued on reverse side.)

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Witching Hour

property.name: Text
property.value: — When choosing 5 Witch-Haunted Woods locations to put into play at random, include the 2 new Witch-Haunted Woods included in this encounter sets, for a total of 9 possibilities. — Set each of the new Arkham Woods locations aside, out of play. (You may optionally gather the Arkham Woods locations included in the Return to The Devour Below and set those aside, as well, if your collection includes them. This encounter set can be found in the Return to the Night of the Zealot expansion.) — When building the act deck, include both versions of act 4. When advancing to act 4a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Witching Hour

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 4a

property.name: Text
property.value: Objective – "Perhaps we can learn more from them..." If there are more than 1π exhausted Witch enemies at the Witches' Circle, investigators at the Witches' Circle may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.

property.value: 2π

property.name: Text
property.value: — Put the Senator Nathaiel Rhodes enemy into play in the Entry Hall, with 1π clues on him. — Put the Wine Cellar location into play. — Set the Spectral version of the Wine Cellar aside, out of play. — Set the Unstable Realm encounter set aside, out of play, instead of the Realm of Death encounter set. Likewise, when act 1b instructs the players to shuffle the Realm of Death encounter set into the encounter deck, shuffle in the Unstable Realm encounter set instead. _____ For the duration of this scenario, the following rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after its attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Text

card.name: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Text
property.value: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: — When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to The Wages of Sins shown here. City of Sins –> City of the Damned Inexorable Fate –> Unspeakable Fate Realm of Death –> Unstable Realm Trapped Spirit –> Bloodthirsty Spirits Witchcraft –> Hexcraft — Set aside Erynn MacAoidh story asset aside, out of play. (Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Text
property.value: — Check Campaign Log. If Erynn wants to meet, when building the act deck, use the new Act 1a—"In Pursuit of Answers" instead of the original act 1, and include both versions of act 2. When advancing to act 2a, put both act cards into play; the text on both cards is active. — Randomly choose one of the two Hangman's Brook locations to use during this scenario's setup. Remove the other version from the game. — When randomly choosing 4 Heretic enemies to set aside, shuffle the 2 new Heretic enemies in with the original 6, for a total of 8 possibilities. _____ For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after its attacks." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 1a

property.name: Text
property.value: Locations cannot be flipped to their Spectral side.

property.name: Clues
property.value: 3π

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 1b

property.name: Text
property.value: Spawn 1 set-aside Hereitc enemy at each of the following locations: The Gallows, Heretic's Graves, Chapel Attic, and Chapel Crypt. Add 2π clues to each location. Put the set-aside Erynn MacAoidh story asset into play at the Haunted Fields, under no player's control. Each investigator puts into play 1 set-aside Spectral Web asset, under their control.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 2a

property.name: Text
property.value: ι When you would "banish" a ghost: You may instead place it beneath Erynn MacAoidh, Heretic side face up. η If you are at Erynn Macaoidh's location, spend 1π clues: Parley. Choose a Hereitc beneath her and palce it beneath this act. Objective – Help Erynn find answers by placing Hereitcs beenath this act. If there are 3 beneath this act, advance.

property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Geist. Witch. Spectral. Elite.

property.name: Text
property.value: Heretic gets +2π health. While Heretic is at a non-Spectral location, it gains aloof and cannot be engaged or damaged. θ Spend 1 clue: Parley. Look at Heretic's other side (without resolving its text). Forced – After Heretic is defeated: Flip it over and resolve the text on its other side.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Text
property.value: Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over. Forced – At the end of the round: You must either discard an asset you control or flip this card back to its enemy side. η If you are at Hangman's Brook and it has no clues on it: Test a skill of your choice (5). If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below). _____ Do not read until this ghost is "banished." Add this card to the victory display. Victory.1

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Geist. Witch. Spectral. Elite.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Text
property.value: Keep this card in your threat area (this side faceup). If you are eliminated, flip it over. Forced – At the start of the enemy phase: If The Spectral Watcher is in play, ready it. η: Evade. Use only on the Spectral Watcher. Use your lowest skill for this evasion attempt. If you succeed, the ghost is "banished" (resolve the text below) (in addition to evading The Spectral Watcher). _____ Do not read until this ghost is "banished." Add this card to the victory display. Victory.1

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to The Wages of Sin

property.name: Text
property.value: Peril. Revelation – If Witchseed is drawn... — ...from the standard encounter deck, shuffle it into the spectral encounter deck. — ...from the spectral encounter deck, trigger each haunted ability on your location twice. You may give Witchweed surge to place it in the standard encounter discard pile.

property.name: Text
property.value: — Choose 1 of the 2 Lounge locations at random. Put it into play along with the rest of the starting locations. Remove the other version of the Lounge from the game. _____ For the duration of this scenario, the following additional rule apply: "The Objective on Act 3a is optional. After all other (α/β/γ/δ) keys have been put into play, if another effect would cause a set-aside key to be put into play, use another unused (+/–) chaos token instead of putting no key into play. At the end of the scenario, add each (+/–) chaos token controlled by an investigator to the victory display. Each one is worth Victory 1." Attach this card to the scenario reference card as a reminder.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Union and Disillusion

V)" and Act 4—"The Binding Rite." _____ For the duration of this scenario, the following rule applies: "While resolving The Watcher's Grasp treachery, The Spectral Watcher does not exhaust after its attacks." property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Union and Disillusion

property.value: Act 3a

property.name: Text

property.value: Return to Union and Disillusion

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 3b

property.name: Text
property.value: Reveal the Geist-Trap location. Move each investigator at an Unvisited Isle location to the Geist-Trap. Spawn the set-aside Anette Mason at The Geist-Trap, with 2π damage on her.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Union and Disillusion

property.name: Traits
property.value: Curse. Hex.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Brazier Enchantment into play next to the agenda deck. Increase the difficulty of each skill test during circle actions on locations by 2. η: Circle. Test your lowest skill + your next lowest skill (6). If you succeed, discard Brazier Enchantment. If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location.

property.value: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

property.name: Text
property.value: ηη: Move all breaches from South Church to the current act. η: Resign. You hide through the night.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to In the Clutches of Chaos

property.name: Text
property.value: η: Move 1 breach from Merchant District to the current act. You may spend any number of charges, secrets, supplies, or ammo from anny assets you control to move that many additional breaches.

card.name: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Text
property.value: Perform the setup as indicated in The Circle Undone Campaign Guide, with the following exceptions: — When gathering encounter sets, also gather the new encounter sets for Return to Before the Black Throne shown here. Inexorable Fate –> Unspeakable Fate Ancient Evils –> Impending Evils (Continued on reverse side.)

alternate.name: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Text
property.value: — When building the act deck, replace the original version of act 3 with the new version included in this encounter set. Remove the original version from the game. — When building the Cosmos, include the 3 new Cosmos locations included in the Return to Before the Black Throne encounter set. — When the game begins, the investigators may remove 2 resources from the scenario reference card to have each investigator begin the game with a Nightgaunt Steed story asset in play. Remove each remaining Nightgaunt Steed from the game.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 3a

property.name: Text
property.value: η Spend X clues: Draw the top X cards of the Cosmos. Choose one to put into play using its "Cosmos –" instructions, and move to it. Shuffle the rest back into the Cosmos. Objective – If the lead investigator is at The Black Throne and there are no clues on it, advance.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Subtitle
property.value: Act 3b

property.name: Text
property.value: Check Campaign Log. — If at least two of the following are true, you may proceed to (–>R2): You accepted your fate, Mesmerizing Flute is listed under "Mementos Discovered," and Ritual Component is listed under "Mementos Discovered." — If at least two of the following are true, you may proceed to (–>R3): You rejected your fate, Scrap of Torn Shadow is listed under "Mementos Discovered," and Wisp of Spectral Mist is listed under "Mementos Discovered." — If Strange Incantation and Bloody Tree Carvings are listed under "Mementos Discovered," you may proceed to (–>R6). — Otherwise, (–>R4).

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Traits
property.value: Otherworld. Void.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cosmos – Connect in a direction of your choice, but only onto a spot where an empty space exists. Remove that empty space from the game instead of shuffling it back into its owner's deck. Then, discard each other copy of that card from play and from each investigator's hand.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Traits
property.value: Otherworld. Void.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cosmos – Connect in the direction nearest to The Black Throne (or any direction if The Black Throne is not in play). While you are at Interstellar Abyss, you cannot spend clues.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Traits
property.value: Otherworld. Void.

property.name: Text
property.value: Cosmos – Connect to the leftmost revealed location in a direction of your choice. Then, you must either immediately move to Winding Gulf or place 1 doom on Azathoth. Haunted – Take 1 damage and 1 horror.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Return to Before the Black Throne

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Nightgaunt.

property.name: Text
property.value: While you control Nightgaunt Steed, you may enter empty space as if it were a location. After you enter empty space, Nightgaunt Steed takes 1 direct damage. Forced – If Nightgaunt Steed leaves play, remove it from the game and move to the nearest revealed location.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ά (2). This test gets +1 difficulty for each non-weakness treachery in your threat area. If you fail, take 2 damage or 2 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Despoiled into play in your threat area. Forced – After you succeed at a skill test during your turn: Increase the difficulty of each subsequent test you perform this turn by 1. η: Test ά (3). If you succeed, discard Despoiled. If there is an exhausted Witch enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Maligned into play in your threat area. Increase the cost of each card you play by 1. η: Test ά (3). If you succeed, discard Despoiled. If there is an exhausted Witch enemy at your location, this test is automatically successful.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Impending Evils

property.name: Text
property.value: Peril. Revelation – You must either take 1 damage and 1 horror, or put Impending Evils into play next to the agenda deck and it gains surge. If there are 3 copies of Impending Evils next to the agenda deck, discard them and advance the current agenda.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Unspeakable Fate

property.name: Traits
property.value: Hazard. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ί (2). If you fail, take 2 damage. If you succeed, put Unavoidable Demise into play next to the agenda deck. While Unavoidable Demise is next to the agenda deck, each other copy of Unavoidable Demise gets +1 difficulty and deals +1 damage if its test is failed.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Unspeakable Fate

property.name: Traits
property.value: Omen. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – If there is no other copy of Fate of All Fools in play, put Fate of All Fools into play in your threat area. Otherwise, an investigator with another copy of Fate of All Fools in their threat area draws the top card of the encounter deck. That card gains peril, its effects cannot be canceled, and cards cannot be committed to skill tests while resolving its revelation effect.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Unstable Realm

property.name: Traits
property.value: Hazard. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Attach to your location. Forced – When you leave attached location: Resolve each haunted ability on it. Forced – At the end of the round: If there are no investigators at attached location, discard Unstable Energies.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Unstable Realm

property.name: Traits
property.value: Terror. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ί (3). If you fail, resolve each haunted ability on your location (if you fail by 3 or more, resolve each of them twice, instead).

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: City of the Damned

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Attach Vice and Villainy to a non-permanent asset you control. Limit 1 per asset. Forced – When the encounter deck runs out of cards: Discard attached asset. Forced – When attached asset leaves play: Test ά (3). If you fail, attach Vice and Villainy to a different non-permanent asset you control.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: City of the Damned

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ί (5). For each point you fail by, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If a Curse treachery is discarded by this effect, deal 1 direct horror to your investigator and to each of your Ally assets.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Chilling Mists

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Test ί (5). If you fail, choose and discard cards from your play area and/or from your hand with a total printed resource cost of at least X, where X is the amount you failed by.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Chilling Mists

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Attach to your location. Attached location gets +1 shroud. Forced – At the end of the round, if there are no clues on attached location: Move Mists from Beyond once toward the nearest location with 1 or more clues.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Bloodthirsty Spirits

property.name: Traits
property.value: Monster. Geist. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Hunter. Forced – When you deal 1 or more damage to Screeching Banshee (except from a Spell or Relic): Resolve each haunted ability at its location.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: Bloodthirsty Spirits

property.name: Traits
property.value: Terror. Spectral.

property.name: Text
property.value: Revelation – Put Bloodthirsty Spirits into play in your threat area. While your location is haunted, as an additional cost for you to commit 1 or more cards to a skill test, you must resolve each haunted ability on your location. Forced – At the end of your turn: Test ά (3). If you succeed, discard Bloodthristy Spirit.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator not defeated during this game earns +2 experience during its resolution.
Reversed: Each investigator defeated during this game earns -2 experience during its resolution.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator begins the game with 3 additional resources.
Reversed: Each investigator begins the game with 3 fewer resrouces, and cannot gain resources during their first turn.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During the first έ test each investigator performs each round, they get +1 έ.
Reversed: During the first έ test each investigator performs each round, they get -1 έ.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During the first ί test each investigator performs each round, they get +1 ί.
Reversed: During the first ί test each investigator performs each round, they get -1 ί.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During the first ή test each investigator performs each round, they get +1 ή.
Reversed: During the first ή test each investigator performs each round, they get -1 ή.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During the first ά test each investigator performs each round, they get +1 ά.
Reversed: During the first ά test each investigator performs each round, they get -1 ά.

property.name: Text
property.value:
When the game begins, each investigator searches their deck for an Ally asset, adds it to their hand, and shuffles their deck.
Reversed: When the game begins, each investigator searches their deck for an Ally asset, remove it from the game, and shuffles their deck.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator begins the game with 2 additional cards in their opening hand.
Reversed: Each investigator begins the game with 2 fewer cards in their opening hand, and cannot draw cards during their first turn.

property.name: Text
property.value:
When the game begins, each investigator may play an asset from their hand at -2 cost.
Reversed: During the first round of the game, each investigator cannot play assets.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Increase each investigator's maximum hand size by 3.
Reversed: Decrease each investigator's maximum hand size by 3.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Once each act, when any investigator reveals an [Autofail] token, the investigators may cancel it and treat it as a 0 token instead.
Reversed: Once each act, the first time any investigator reveals an ε token, cancel it and treat it as a -5 token instead.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Cancel the first doom that would be placed in the final agenda of the game.
Reversed: The final agenda of the game enters play with 1 doom on it.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During setup, each investigator may take up to 2 additional mulligans.
Reversed: Each investigator cannot mulligan or replace weaknesses in their opening hand (resolve their revelation abilities when the game begins).

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator gets +1 health.
Reversed: Each investigator gets -1 health.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator gets +1 sanity.
Reversed: Each investigator gets -1 sanity.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator has 1 additional slot of a type chosen by that investigator when the game begins.
Reversed: Each investigator has 3 fewer slots, each of a different type, chosen by that investigator when the game begins.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator chooses 1 basic weakness in their deck and removes it from the game (return them after the game ends).
Reversed: Add 1 random basic weakness to each investigator's deck. Remove them after the game ends.

property.name: Text
property.value:
After an investigator reveals an ε token during a skill test, they may heal 1 damage or 1 horror.
Reversed: After an investigator reveals an [Autofail] token during a skill test, they must either take 1 damage or 1 horror.

property.name: Text
property.value:
The first time each investigator's deck would run out of cards, they may shuffle the bottom 10 cards of their discard pile back into their deck.
Reversed: When the game begins, each investigator discard the top 5 cards of their deck. Shuffle each discarded weakness into its owner's deck.

property.name: Text
property.value:
During each investigator's first turn, they may take 2 additional actions.
Reversed: During each investigator's first turn, they have 2 fewer actions to take.

property.name: Text
property.value:
When the game begins, replace a α token in the chaos bag with a 0 token. Swap them back after the game ends.
Reversed: When the game begins, replace the highest non-negative token in the chaos bag with a α token. Swap them back after the game ends.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Each investigator not defeated during this game may remove 1 trauma of their choice during its resolution.
Reversed: Each investigator defeated during this game suffers 1 trauma of their choice during its resolution.
